s.text: The bad news: There's no relief in sight for the South.
2) The Army, which, unlike the other services, thinks officers should be allowed to fraternize with enlisted personnel who are not in their chain of command.

The good news: We're doing a lot better than Papua New Guinea, where a 23 foot tsunami killed an estimated 3,000 people July 17 and left their corpses to be devoured by crocodiles.
The softhearted spin: Sharpton will suffer the worst damage because, ironically, he is the only one of the advisers to have sought to moderate his public image.
